#summary This page describe the wlsagent Nagios plugin.

= Introduction =

Wlsagent is a small JMX client, which exposes some performance metrics for WebLogic servers 9.x and 10.x.

You can get the performance data by submitting simple HTTP requests to the plugin. Below is an example of unix CLI invocation with wget :

wget -q -O - http://localhost:8080/wlsagent/WlsAgent?hostname=localhost&port=7001&username=nagios&password=nagios&jvm=UsedMemory;80;90&thread-pool=ThreadActiveCount;90;95&jta=ActiveTransactions;100;120&component=testservlet;100;150|dashboard;100;150&jdbc=ds1;2;4'

The plugin is listening on port 8080, and the WebLogic server we want to monitor is listening on the port 7001 of the same machine ('hostname' and 'port' parameters). The parameters 'username' and 'password' are used to authenticate, notice the WebLogic user specified only have to belong to the monitor group.
